response_text:
Looking at these two pages of a historical German letter, I can identify the following information:

```json
{
    "letter_title": ["Betrifft Kauf \"Rheinfelden\""],
    "send_date": ["1928-04-02"],
    "sender_persons": ["null"],
    "receiver_persons": ["Basler Personenschiffahrtsgesellschaft"]
}
```

The letter is dated "Basel, den 2. April 1928" (Basel, April 2, 1928) and addressed to "Basler Personenschiffahrtsgesellschaft" (Basel Passenger Shipping Company) in Basel. The subject line "Betrifft Kauf \"Rheinfelden\"" indicates this letter concerns the purchase of "Rheinfelden" (likely a ship). While there appears to be a signature at the bottom of the second page, the sender's name is not clearly legible from the signature alone and is not typed elsewhere in the letter.
